item.content:encoded: John McAfee Wanted for Murder http://t.co/obuwx2f4 Antivirus pioneer John McAfee is on the run from murder charges, Belize police say. According to Marco Vidal, head of the national police force's Gang Suppression Unit, McAfee is a prime suspect in the murder of American expatriate Gregory Faull, who was gunned down Saturday night at his home in San Pedro Town on the island of Ambergris Caye. item.content:encoded: Is Apple’s Magic Officially Gone? http://t.co/eZfIuekD #tech #news Most people seem to think Apple will always be the Apple so many people have come to know and love in recent years, but Steve Jobs would be the first person to remind us that even the mighty can fall (and fall hard). item.content:encoded: #photography A Question of Color — Answered: We may see the world in color, but for a long ... http://t.co/Ny5i4Khk (vía @nytimesphoto) We may see the world in color, but for a long time the world of "serious" photography dismissed it as an unworthy commercial cousin. item.title: FBI knew of Petraeus-Broadwell affair in the summer - Hot Air
item.description: [HotAir] FBI knew of Petraeus-Broadwell affair in the summer http://t.co/IKzrFl6Q
item.content:encoded: [HotAir] FBI knew of Petraeus-Broadwell affair in the summer http://t.co/IKzrFl6Q The timing of the resignation of David Petraeus looks more curious as the days go by. Yesterday, Sen Dianne Feinstein said that the FBI should have notified the Congressional intelligence committees as soon as they knew that CIA Director David Petraeus was either under suspicion or under threat. Last night, the Wall Street Journal reports that the FBI and the Department of Justice knew months ago of the affair between Petraeus and his biographer Paula Broadwell, and that Broadwell was the source of the e-mails that had prompted their investigation in the first place: Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: hotair.com

item.title: Diez cosas que debes saber sobre Alemania | Blogoterráqueo | Blogs | elmundo.es
item.description: Diez cosas que debes saber sobre Alemania http://t.co/pUaKeGJS vía @elmundoes
item.content:encoded: Diez cosas que debes saber sobre Alemania http://t.co/pUaKeGJS vía @elmundoes En Alemania se habla alemán, parece obvio, pero a menudo se minusvalora la barrera lingüística. Aunque hayas estudiado alemán, incluso aunque incluyas en tu curriculum un certificado B1 o, mejor aún, B2, tú no hablas alemán. Y lo sabes. Eso te lo pondrá muy difícil a la hora de integrarte en una empresa, en constante competencia. Para hablar alemán es necesario un proceso que requiere, además del estudio, tiempo de práctica y convivencia con alemanes. A esto hay que añadir la dificultad extra que presentan los acentos y dialectos de los diferentes Länder. Practicar alemán con los alemanes, además, no es una consecuencia automática de la convivencia. Puedes pasar semanas sin intercambiar más que escuetos saludos con tus compañeros del trabajo y tus compañeros de piso, que con toda seguridad intentarán dirigirse a ti en inglés o en español. Trabar auténticas relaciones en Alemania lleva años y el proceso de integración lingüística también. Debes estar preparado para un aislamiento prolongado. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: elmundo.es

item.title: Demonoid Is Back, BitTorrent Tracker is Now Online | TorrentFreak
item.description: via @torrentfreak Demonoid Is Back, BitTorrent Tracker is Now Online http://t.co/KemIjrvh
item.content:encoded: via @torrentfreak Demonoid Is Back, BitTorrent Tracker is Now Online http://t.co/KemIjrvh After three and a half months of downtime Demonoid's tracker is now back online. The unexpected revival of the tracker is the first sign of life in weeks and suggests that the Demonoid team is working to bring the full site back online. While the index and forum remain offline, the many thousands of torrents tracked by Demonoid have been brought back to life. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: torrentfreak.com

item.title: The GOP's media cocoon - Jonathan Martin
item.description: Politico has a startling revelation. People are selectively choosing media outlets based on political leaning http://t.co/9DMmzXog
item.content:encoded: Politico has a startling revelation. People are selectively choosing media outlets based on political leaning http://t.co/9DMmzXog A long-simmering generational battle in the conservative movement is boiling over after last week’s shellacking, with younger operatives and ideologues going public with calls that Republicans break free from a political-media cocoon that has become intellectually suffocating and self-defeating. GOP officials have chalked up their electoral thumping... Link - Trackbacks

item.content:encoded: Will Obama Tax the Internet?: President Barack Obama pulled it off - he won reelection. He did this despite the ... http://t.co/4w4d0tjZ President Barack Obama pulled it off - he won reelection. He did this despite the fake unemployment rate being above 8% throughout his first term. The real unemployment rate was 14.7% when people went to the polls, and it was oh so much universally worse than just that. Link - Trackbacks
